instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3298: What is 820-3298? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3298</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 27" Late 2012 max resolution 1280x720
threads.message:
When the iMac starts up and before the Apple logo the screen looks like an old TV searching for channels (Sorry I dont have a better way to explain this)

- Once the logo comes up the logo looks very large.
- The problem happens more often than not.
- There is external video and with that I have higher resolution options.

Already tried known good screen, different LCD cable, clean BIOS and different OS.

I have also seen this in a 27" 2013 model

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3298</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 27" Late 2012 max resolution 1280x720
threads.message:
Heat GPU until 180-200 degrees, no much.
15-20 sec should be good enough for test.
